description: The Congestion Charge applies to central London only and does not include the Dartford Crossing Dart Charge.

texts: Be careful not to mix up the letters 'I ' and 'O ' with the numbers '1 ' and '0 '.
Choose the country of registration carefully. If you pick the wrong one you risk getting a penalty.

Based on the vehicle registration (VRM) details that you have entered and the classification information held by Transport for London (TfL) on this day, your vehicle is deemed 100% discounted and you are not required to pay the congestion charge.
If you believe that this information is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, then you can continue.
Please be aware that classification may change without notification, so you should always check to see if payment is required for journeys into the zone.
This is based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zone.
Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today, this vehicle is exempt from the Congestion Charge, ULEZ charges and LEZ charges.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zones.
If the number plate (Vehicle Registration Mark) is correct but the description shown is wrong, you can still pay charges for this vehicle.
Vehicle information is provided to us by the DVLA, so you'll need to let the DVLA know if your details are wrong or need to be updated.
We do not hold details for this vehicle
UK-registered: If your vehicle’s make and model details have not been returned, make sure you entered the number plate (Vehicle Registration Mark) correctly before continuing.
Registered outside the United Kingdom: We are unable to display the make, model and colour information. Confirm this is the correct vehicle to continue.
To add another vehicle, you will first need to remove one. You can amend your Quick Management list details when you have finished paying for this vehicle.

Cars, vans, minibuses, buses, coaches and HGVs, motorised caravans and horseboxes, breakdown and recovery vehicles, private ambulances, motor hearses, dual purpose vehicles and other specialist vehicle types that do not meet the minimum Euro emission standards are subject to the T-Charge.
Motorised tricycles and quadricycles that are subject to the Congestion Charge are also affected. Motorcycles are not subject to the T-Charge.

9+ seater vehicles that are currently registered for a discount or are exempt from paying the charge will need to meet the required emissions standards or pay the T-Charge. The minimum emissions standards are Euro 4/IV for both petrol and diesel vehicles and Euro 3 for motorised tricycles and quadricycles.
The T-Charge is a daily, not a one off charge. If your vehicle does not meet the emissions standards the additional T-Charge value will be automatically added when you pay the Congestion Charge.
Find more information about the T-Charge
